# Discord Chat Analysis for üíª‚îÇdevelopers Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around technical discussions related to Hyperfy development. Key topics include:

- Issues with 3D model imports and animations in Hyperfy, particularly with .glb files
- A proposed PR for error logging functionality to enhance remote debugging capabilities
- The update of hyper-nat to be npx-based and Hyperfy-friendly, enabling direct game sharing without servers
- A temporary downtime of the "vibe world" with building and AI features disabled
- Questions about OpenXR compatibility with Hyperfy
- Discussion about potential npm package security vulnerabilities, though Hyperfy appears unaffected due to minimal dependencies

The most significant technical advancement mentioned is the update to hyper-nat, which now allows developers to share their Hyperfy games directly with collaborators using a simple npx command, facilitating pair programming without server requirements.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How do I make an animated .glb object work in my Hyperfy space? (asked by Nicola Bertoglio) A: Download the .hype file, drag and drop it in your world, click the cube icon, upload your .glb, and select the animation in the .hype app UI. (answered by Gert-Jan Akerboom)
Q: Is there a way to access Hyperfy via openXR? (asked by MetaMike) A: Unanswered
Q: What did you do to fix the build error on Digital Ocean? (asked by marlus) A: Unanswered
Q: Are the npm packages in the recent security breach affecting Hyperfy? (asked by maximus) A: No, Hyperfy intentionally has minimal dependencies to avoid bloat, which helps in this case. (answered by ash)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Nicola Bertoglio | Context: Animated .glb object not working in Hyperfy space | Resolution: Provided step-by-step instructions to use a .hype file to properly import and animate the model
Helper: Shiffty | Helpee: highlander | Context: Issues with Miximo exports | Resolution: Shared a link to properly converted Hyperfy emotes in the right format
